question_text: Which of the following best describes an elastic collision?
options: A collision in which the colliding bodies stick together.
A collision in which both momentum and kinetic energy are conserved.
A collision in which momentum is not conserved.
A collision that transforms all kinetic energy into heat and sound.
correct_answer: A collision in which both momentum and kinetic energy are conserved.
explanation: In an elastic collision, by definition, not only is momentum conserved, but kinetic energy is also conserved. This distinguishes it from inelastic collisions where some kinetic energy is lost.
